attributes.action: Stop allowing car insurance companies over charging under 25s.
attributes.additional_details: Young drivers are facing premiums nearly 4x more higher than the average driver, there's been an 8.2% annual rise in premiums for under 20s, seen on Confused.com. The Commons Transport Committee was told youngsters believe they are being priced off the road. The average price of a premium for a 17-20 year old in the 3rd quarter of the year was £3,878 when insured as the only driver. The average older driver is priced at £1,006, not only is this unfair but stopping youngsters from aspiring.
attributes.background: Under 25s are facing high prices for car insurance. If the government want equality, they should be given the same price and advantages compared to a 30 year old. £1000s difference and it's unfair as littler pay is being offered to under 18s also living and educational costs are on the increase.
